This, combined with incubation periods that could be over a week [ 26, 46], suggest that human travel could be an important route for transmission of bat-borne zoonotic viruses into the EU. The recent MERS-CoV cases in the EU highlight the risk of virus introduction from human travel [ 27]. There has been one high profile case of tourism leading to an introduction of MARV into the EU [ 17, 18]. A similar, but non-fatal, incident from a person who visited the same bat cave in Uganda also occurred in the USA [ 52]. Neither incident resulted in identified infection in other individuals.
